headline: Trump-backed U.S. Rep. Alex Mooney wins West Virginia GOP primary
author: LEAH WILLINGHAM
sentences:
The groundwork we have laid over the last 12 years has paved the way for a more prosperous and diverse West Virginia economy.?

In the general election, Mooney will face Barry Wendell, an openly gay former Morgantown City Council member who bested security operations manager Angela Dwyer during Tuesdays Democratic primary.

CHARLESTON, W.Va. 
In an early victory for a candidate endorsed by former President Trump at the start of midterm season, Rep. Alex Mooney on Tuesday beat fellow incumbent Rep. David B. McKinley in West Virginias 2nd Congressional District Republican primary.

Earlier Tuesday night, Trump-endorsed incumbent U.S. Rep. Carol Miller breezed to the Republican nomination in West Virginias 1st Congressional District, defeating four little-known candidates and setting herself on a clear path to reelection.

In Nebraskas 2nd Congressional District, in the Omaha area, three-term Republican Rep. Don Bacon won the primary over long-shot candidate Steve Kuehl, a consultant who got a shoutout from Trump when the former president visited this month.

The two incumbents, who have taken dramatically different approaches to their time in office, were pitted against each other in the states 2nd Congressional District after population losses cost West Virginia a U.S. House seat.

McKinley, who has represented the state in the House since 2011, said in a statement Tuesday night that serving the people of West Virginia had been the honor of his life  and made a subtle reference to the infrastructure vote.

Flood wants to fill the seat abandoned by Jeff Fortenberry, a Republican who resigned from office and ended his reelection bid after he was convicted of lying to federal authorities about an illegal campaign contribution.

McKinley was sharply criticized by the former president when he broke with his party as one of 13 Republicans to vote with Democrats to support President Bidens $1.2-trillion infrastructure bill.
